Definition: In this task, you will be given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You need to determine whether the Head happens after the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Spatial Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, opening the door happens before going out. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.explanation: Accommodating is not an event that happens before the Head. So the output should be "No".
